content:
I am building it from source on a macbook pro, getting to 99%, and then having a linker error (related to c0 / crt0). When I solve it, I can make it available (or make a PR to the Vampire lib).

In the meantime -is anyone perhaps using a dockerized vampire on a mac? Would love to try it out.

Update for everyone interested: "We can provide Mac binaries but these can be OS X version specific due to linking issues — please contact Giles Reger for any queries."

from their website. So I guess I'll just use a shell.
What is the linker error you get?

crt0 / c0: 

ld: library not found for -lcrt0.o
clang: **error:** **linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)**

If I didn't have a shell, I'd prioritize this, since I am excited about Vampire.
crt0 is the base C runtime, it sounds like you may not have a full toolchain installed locally. I'm not sure how you have clang intsalled then

Vlad Tsyrklevich schrieb:

crt0 is the base C runtime, it sounds like you may not have a full toolchain installed locally. I'm not sure how you have clang intsalled then

No, I have everything. I get the technology side of this. No worries- not critical atm.
Michael Bucko has marked this topic as resolved.
Btw. I have a build working very well on a mac (used the cosmopolitan branch). If anyone needs it, feel free to let me know.
